FRONTEND WEB DEVELOPER

Robert Schuster

Projects

    Guess the Word Game

    Description I utilized JavaScript to provide user interaction to guess letters to a word that is chosen randomly from a local API. The user is allowed a specified number of guesses.

    Skills:

    • JavaScript
    • API Call
    • Concepts of match(), split(), trip(), join()
    • Single simple regular expresions to find text pattern matches

    Tools:

    • VS Code
    • Chrome DevTools
    • GitHub version control
    • Git

    GitHub Repo

    Description Using JavaScript I fetched the API from my GitHub account to display my Public Repos in the DOM. I created global variables, event listeners, Click event that uses matches() method, and an async function to pull data of a specific repo, and a dynamic search of my Repos.

    Skills:

    • JavaScript
    • Fetch API JSON data
    • Create Dynamic Search
    • Create Global Variables

    Tools:

    • VS Code
    • Chrome DevTools
    • GitHub version control
    • Git

    Sticky Notes

    Description This project uses HTML, CSS, and JSX to accept user input, save state to local storage. The user has the ability to search, add and delete items as they desire.

    Skills:

    • JavaScript React
    • Greenfield project build
    • UI Component breakdown
    • JSX
    • ES6
    • Managing Data Flow
    • State and Props Values

    Tools:

    • VS Code
    • Chrome DevTools
    • Codesandbox

    Unplugged Retreat

    Description From a design comp for a 3 page website, I hand-coded a fully responsive 3 page webpage to the specifications listed. I used Gimp to view the design comp and its elements. I coded the site using Atom and VS Code, and checked compatibility using Chrome DevTools.

    Tech Skills:

    • HTML / CSS
    • Responsive Web Design
    • FlexBox Properties
    • Git and GitHub
    • Dissecting a Design Comp

    Tools:

    • VS Code
    • Chrome DevTools
    • Git and GitHub version control
    • Gimp

About Me

Hi! I'm Rob

I'm a Front End Web Developer

I have loved programming since writing basic programming in school.
I began building web pages as a way to practice coding. I have been hooked on Front End Web Development ever since.
I tend to lose track of time as a web page takes shape, and my excitement grows with every commit saved to GitHub.
The continuous evolution of web protocols and syntax help keep the practice of Web Development enticing and challenging. Sometimes searching the web to find a solution for coding a particular feature is the most rewarding part.

Fun Fact!

If I am not traveling, I enjoy jogging, walking, and biking, along with a short Netflix binge too.
